uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class GISScaledKey<T extends java.lang.Number>

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.AbstractGISRasterImageConverter<T>
      uk.ac.macaulay.util.GISScaledKey<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GISScaledKey<T>>, GISRasterImageConverter<T>, PartialOrderComparable<GISScaledKey<T>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GISHSBScaledKey, GISRGBScaledKey
public abstract class GISScaledKey<T extends java.lang.Number>
extends AbstractGISRasterImageConverter<T>
implements GISRasterImageConverter<T>, java.lang.Comparable<GISScaledKey<T>>, PartialOrderComparable<GISScaledKey<T>>

This is an abstract class for keys that map a single range of values onto a straight line through colour space. This is for GISRasters that use a Number as the entry in the table. Although this class accepts any Number, everything is in fact converted to a double, so if you're using large longs, BigIntegers or BigDecimals, it probably won't work very well. When converting back from the line of colours to the scaled value, each colour parameter will return its own value for the scaled value. If these numbers are too different, then the colour is assumed not to be on the straight line through colour space, and an exception is thrown. The colour parameters at the minimum and maximum of the scale are not assumed to be greater or less than each other.

Author:
Gary Polhill

getEntry

public T getEntry(java.awt.Color colour)
Return the entry for a given colour. A small tolerance in the difference between entries is allowed to detect when the bands give different values for the entry and hence the colour in the argument is not part of the original scale. If there is any difference in value, the entry returned will be that from the band with maximum difference between minimum and maximum, as this should offer the greatest accuracy.

Specified by:
getEntry in interface GISRasterImageConverter<T extends java.lang.Number>
Parameters:
colour - The colour to convert to an entry
Returns:
The entry for the specified colour
See Also:
GISRasterImageConverter.getEntry(java.awt.Color)

partialOrderCompareTo

public PartialOrderComparison partialOrderCompareTo(GISScaledKey<T> arg)
Compare this with another GISScaledKey, using partial order comparison

Specified by:
partialOrderCompareTo in interface PartialOrderComparable<GISScaledKey<T extends java.lang.Number>>
Parameters:
arg - The other GISScaledKey
Returns:
LESS_THAN if this scale range is less than the arguments, and they do not overlap; MORE_THAN if this scale range is more than the arguments, and they do not overlap; EQUAL_TO if the ranges are the same; INCOMPARABLE otherwise.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Build a string describing this object, including information on the class name, the type, the minimum and maximum values, and the colours at these points. An example would be GISRGBScaledKey<Double>[-10.0: #000000, 10.0: #FFFFFF]
